[Sunken Pistol](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1180)
</title>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 163</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Dragon Mouth Pistol](/Weapons.aspx?ID=200)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Perception** +12; precise vision 30 feet, imprecise hearing 30 feet

**Communication** speech ([Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1))

**Skills** [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +19, [Navigation Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +14, Sailing Lore +14

**Int** +0, **Wis** +2, **Cha** +4

**Will** +16 

</column>

---        

A _sunken pistol_ is imbued with the unfulfilled desires and insatiable greed of its previous wielder, a notorious pirate drowned at sea. Once a beautiful and artistically wrought weapon, a _sunken pistol_ is coated in a fine layer of dried salt and encrusted with barnacles. Each shot fired from this _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [dragon mouth pistol](/Weapons.aspx?ID=200)_ is now coated in a layer of salty ectoplasm and has the effects of a [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) rune. You can shoot the _sunken pistol_ underwater, even when using black powder ammunition.

 A _sunken pistol_ urges you to amass a horde of treasure even a dragon would be proud of. The methods used to acquire these riches matter not to the greedy pirate pistol, so long as you amass and hoard excessive wealth. Above all else, a _sunken pistol_ desires the return of its own treasure, which might rest in the wreck of its sunken ship's hold or be hidden on a dangerous island.

 In pursuit of treasure, a sunken pistol offers nautical and navigation advice to you, though it refuses such aid during less lucrative ventures. If you prove a profitable partner, the sunken pistol aids you in combat by [Demoralizing](/Actions.aspx?ID=53) your opponents (see the first Activation below). If you prove charitable or unwilling to retrieve its treasure, the _sunken pistol_ turns its ire on you, Demoralizing you during combat until you relent. If you repeatedly refuse the _sunken pistol_, it would be wise to not accept [_water breathing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=370) from it, as it might attempt to drown you to allow a more suitable wielder to acquire it from your corpse. The _sunken pistol_ can use the following activations.
